decks.notes: The main concept of this Legacy Stoneblade control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while leveraging powerful synergies between cards. By using cards like Force of Will and Stifle to interact with the opponent, as well as utilizing Stoneforge Mystic to find powerful equipment like Meteor Sword, the deck aims to control the board and win through incremental advantage. The inclusion of cards like Tamiyo, Teferi, and Lavinia further adds to the disruptive nature of the deck, making it challenging for the opponent to execute their strategy effectively.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf. By disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will, the deck aims to maintain tempo and control the pace of the game. With a combination of efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and disruptive cards like Daze, the deck seeks to outmaneuver the opponent and secure victory through a combination of aggression and disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize artifact creatures and spells to generate a quick and aggressive offense while disrupting the opponent's game plan with control elements like Force of Will and Sink into Stupor. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Saga provide additional value by recurring artifacts and creating powerful tokens, giving the deck resilience and versatility. The combination of cheap artifacts, mana acceleration, and powerful creatures allows for a fast and overwhelming strategy that can put pressure on the opponent while disrupting their strategies.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo pieces to play Show and Tell, putting either Omniscience or Emrakul, the Aeons Torn onto the battlefield for a game-winning turn. The deck includes powerful cards like Force of Will for protection and cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm to dig for key pieces. The mana base includes fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent mana production, and cards like Lotus Petal provide additional ramp. The deck's strategy is to quickly set up and execute the combo before the opponent can establish their own game plan.

This deck focuses on utilizing Cradle Control to ramp up and generate huge amounts of mana to quickly cast powerful creatures and spells. The deck includes cards like Natural Order and Green Sun's Zenith to search for key creatures, while also running disruptive cards like Collector Ouphe and Endurance to control the opponent's board. By efficiently using mana dorks like Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise, this deck can establish a dominant board presence and overwhelm the opponent. The goal is to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent to secure the win.

The main concept of this deck is to use aggressive Eldrazi creatures and disruptive spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Chalice of the Void to disrupt the opponent's plays and Eldrazi Temple to power out big threats early, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent and close out the game quickly. Cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher provide additional disruption and damage, while also being difficult threats for the opponent to deal with. The deck's mana base is designed to support the Eldrazi creatures and maximize the efficiency of their powerful abilities.

This deck focuses on applying consistent pressure on the opponent through a mix of aggressive creatures and efficient spells. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building up its own board presence to deliver quick and decisive attacks. The combination of cheap disruption spells like Daze and Thoughtseize, along with powerful threats like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent, creates a versatile and potent strategy. The deck utilizes a variety of tactics, from tempo plays with Brazen Borrower to burn spells like Lightning Bolt, to maintain control of the game and secure a victory.

This deck focuses on swarming the board with low-cost white creatures and disrupting the opponent with taxing effects like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient aggro strategy. The deck also includes control elements like Static Prison and Swords to Plowshares to keep the opponent in check. With cards like Windbrisk Heights and Emeria's Call providing additional value, the deck aims to outpace the opponent and close out the game quickly.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's resources and control the game through cards like Smallpox, Malevolent Rumble, and Thoughtseize. The deck also aims to generate value through recurring lands with Life from the Loam and utilizing the Urza's Saga land to search for key artifacts. The combination of resource denial, creature removal, and land recursion allows the deck to maintain control of the battlefield and outvalue the opponent in the long run.

The deck focuses on quickly getting out powerful cards like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Omniscience using the combo Show and Tell. It also includes protection cards like Force of Will and Daze to ensure the combo goes off smoothly. The deck aims to disrupt opponents with cards like Veil of Summer and stock up on resources with card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder. It also includes cards like Cunning Wish for additional flexibility in finding key combo pieces.

This deck aims to quickly cycle through all spells in order to turbo mill the opponent's entire deck, leading to a win condition that relies on graveyard interactions. The key strategy involves casting multiple spells in rapid succession using mana acceleration, searching for combo pieces, and disrupting the opponent's game plan with discard spells. The primary win condition is a graveyard-based combo that can quickly assemble an unbeatable board state. The deck's main focus is on executing a powerful combo while utilizing a variety of spells to ensure consistency and protection.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly through cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal, then use spells like Infernal Tutor and Burning Wish to search for combo pieces, ultimately casting Tendrils of Agony to deal a massive amount of damage to the opponent in one turn. The deck also includes various discard spells like Duress and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan, as well as card draw spells like Ponder and Brainstorm to find the necessary combo pieces. Gaea's Will and Galvanic Relay provide additional ways to generate mana and draw cards, respectively.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using Gaea's Cradle and various mana dorks, then utilizing powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Craterhoof Behemoth to take control of the game. It also includes a toolbox of creatures to search for with Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order, providing flexibility and answers to different situations. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence and overpower the opponent with a combination of efficient mana generation and powerful threats.

This deck aims to quickly cheat big and impactful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn onto the battlefield using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. It also utilizes cards like Stock Up and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to manipulate the hand and library, ensuring that the combo pieces come together smoothly. With strong protection from cards like Force of Will and Veil of Summer, the deck can execute its game plan efficiently while disrupting the opponent's strategies. Overall, the deck's strength lies in its ability to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

The deck is focused on quickly casting a large number of spells to fill the graveyard with creatures, then using cards like Dread Return and Reanimate to bring them back onto the battlefield. The goal is to mill the entire library and win the game with Thassa's Oracle or Poxwalkers. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Pact of Negation and Cabal Therapy to protect the combo and disrupt opponents' strategies. The key to winning is to carefully manage resources and timing to execute the combo efficiently.

The deck focuses on utilizing Lands to control the game, utilizing cards like Urza's Saga, Life from the Loam, and Wasteland to disrupt opponents while ramping into powerful late-game threats like Dark Depths. The deck also includes utility lands like Bojuka Bog and The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale to further control the battlefield. With cards like Crop Rotation and Mox Diamond to quickly set up advantageous board states, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through a combination of land destruction, resource denial, and powerful win conditions.
